foreignData.text:
Bonus {X} (Du kannst zusätzlich {X} bezahlen, sowie du diesen Zauberspruch spielst.)
Verwende nur farbiges Mana für X. Du kannst maximal ein Mana jeder Farbe dabei ausgeben.

foreignData.name: Golem blasonné
foreignData.text:
Kick {X} (Vous pouvez payer {X} supplémentaire quand vous jouez ce sort.)
Ne dépensez que du mana coloré dans X. Vous ne pouvez pas dépenser de cette manière plus d'un mana de chaque couleur.
Si vous avez payé le coût de kick, le Golem blasonné arrive en jeu avec X marqueurs +1/+1 sur lui.

foreignData.name: Golem Decorato
foreignData.text:
Potenziamento {X} (Puoi spendere {X} addizionale mentre giochi questa magia).
Spendi solo mana colorato per pagare X. Non puoi spendere più di un mana per ogni colore in questo modo.
Se hai pagato il costo di potenziamento, Il Golem Decorato entra in gioco con X segnalini +1/+1 su di esso.

mainBoard.name: Emblazoned Golem

mainBoard.originalText: When Quirion Trailblazer comes into play, you may search your library for a basic land card and put that card into play tapped. If you do, shuffle your library.

rulings.text: The land does not count toward your normal limit of playing one land per turn.
Because the “search” requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don’t have to find the card if you don’t want to.

mainBoard.name: Stratadon
mainBoard.originalText:
Stratadon costs o1 less to play for each basic land type among lands you control.
Trample

rulings.text: To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.

How many lands you control of a particular basic land type is irrelevant to a domain ability, as long as that number is greater than zero. As far as domain is concerned, ten Forests is the same as one Forest.

A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don’t count the number of lands you control — they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you’ll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.

mainBoard.text:
Domain — This spell costs {1} less to cast for each basic land type among lands you control.
Trample

mainBoard.name: Captain's Maneuver
mainBoard.originalText: The next X damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn is dealt to another target creature or player instead.

rulings.text: If the second target is no longer on the battlefield, or if the second target is no longer a creature, player, or planeswalker when the damage would be redirected, the damage is dealt to the first target as if this spell was not cast.
If the first target is no longer on the battlefield, then the damage will not be dealt at all, so it can’t be redirected by this ability.

mainBoard.name: Harrow
mainBoard.originalText:
As an additional cost to play Harrow, sacrifice a land.
Search your library for up to two basic land cards and put them into play. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: The sacrifice of a land is part of the cost of casting Harrow. You can’t pay this cost more than once to get a multiple effect.
The two lands do not count toward your normal one land you can play each turn.
Because the “search” requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don’t have to find the card if you don’t want to.

mainBoard.name: Allied Strategies
mainBoard.originalText: Target player draws a card for each basic land type among lands he or she controls.

rulings.text: You draw one card per basic land type, not for each basic land. This makes it a maximum of 5 cards.

To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.

How many lands you control of a particular basic land type is irrelevant to a domain ability, as long as that number is greater than zero. As far as domain is concerned, ten Forests is the same as one Forest.

A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don’t count the number of lands you control — they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you’ll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.

mainBoard.text: Domain — Target player draws a card for each basic land type among lands they control.

Passa in rassegna il tuo grimorio per una carta terra base di ogni tipo e mettile in gioco. Poi rimescola il tuo grimorio.

mainBoard.name: Gaea's Balance
mainBoard.originalText:
As an additional cost to play Gaea's Balance, sacrifice five lands.
Search your library for a land card of each basic land type and put them into play. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: You can find a nonbasic land card this way as long as it has a basic land type, such as Stomping Ground.
You can fail to find a land card for any or all basic land types, even if a land card with that basic land type is in your library.

mainBoard.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice five lands.
Search your library for a land card of each basic land type and put them onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

foreignData.name: Letztes Gefecht
foreignData.text: Ein Gegner deiner Wahl verliert 2 Lebenspunkte für jeden Sumpf, den du kontrollierst. Das letzte Gefecht fügt einer Kreatur deiner Wahl Schadenspunkte in Höhe der Anzahl der Gebirge, die du kontrollierst, zu. Bringe für jeden Wald, den du kontrollierst, einen 1/1 grünen Saproling-Spielstein ins Spiel. Du erhältst für jede Ebene, die du kontrollierst, 2 Lebenspunkte dazu. Ziehe eine Karte für jede Insel, die du kontrollierst und wirf dann genausoviele Karten ab.

foreignData.name: Dernier carré
foreignData.text: L'adversaire ciblé perd 2 points de vie pour chaque marais que vous contrôlez. Le Dernier carré inflige à la créature ciblée un nombre de blessures égal au nombre de montagnes que vous contrôlez. Mettez en jeu un jeton de créature 1/1 verte Saprobionte pour chaque forêt que vous contrôlez. Vous gagnez 2 points de vie pour chaque plaine que vous contrôlez. Piochez une carte pour chaque île que vous contrôlez, puis défaussez-vous d'autant de cartes de votre main.

foreignData.name: Resistenza Estrema
foreignData.text: L'avversario bersaglio perde 2 punti vita per ogni palude che controlli. La Resistenza Estrema infligge un ammontare di danni pari al numero di montagne che controlli a una creatura bersaglio. Metti in gioco una pedina creatura Saprolingio 1/1 verde per ogni foresta che controlli. Guadagni 2 punti vita per ogni pianura che controlli. Pesca una carta per ogni isola che controlli, poi scarta altrettante carte dalla tua mano.

mainBoard.name: Last Stand
mainBoard.originalText: Target opponent loses 2 life for each swamp you control. Last Stand deals damage equal to the number of mountains you control to target creature. Put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token into play for each forest you control. You gain 2 life for each plains you control. Draw a card for each island you control, then discard that many cards from your hand.
mainBoard.text: Target opponent loses 2 life for each Swamp you control. Last Stand deals damage to target creature equal to the number of Mountains you control. Create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token for each Forest you control. You gain 2 life for each Plains you control. Draw a card for each Island you control, then discard that many cards.

mainBoard.flavorText: Victory favors neither the righteous nor the wicked. It favors the prepared.

foreignData.flavorText: Die Siegesgöttin bevorzugt weder die Rechtschaffenen noch die Bösen. Sie favorisiert die, die sich vorbereitet haben.
foreignData.name: Landschaftsbild
foreignData.text: Durchsuche deine Bibliothek nach einem Standardland, zeige die Karte offen vor und nimm sie in deine Hand. Mische danach deine Bibliothek.

foreignData.flavorText: La victoire ne sourit ni au fort ni au faible. Elle sourit à celui qui la prépare.
foreignData.name: Disposition du terrain
foreignData.text: Cherchez dans votre bibliothèque une carte de terrain de base, révélez cette carte et mettez-la dans votre main. Mélangez ensuite votre bibliothèque.

foreignData.flavorText: La vittoria non favorisce i giusti né i crudeli. Favorisce solo chi è meglio preparato.
foreignData.name: Disposizione del Terreno
foreignData.text: Passa in rassegna il tuo grimorio per una carta terra base, rivela quella carta e aggiungila alla tua mano. Poi rimescola il tuo grimorio.

mainBoard.name: Lay of the Land
mainBoard.originalText: Search your library for a basic land card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: Because the “search” requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don’t have to find the card if you don’t want to.

mainBoard.text: Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

mainBoard.name: Death
mainBoard.originalText: Return target creature card from your graveyard to play. You lose life equal to its converted mana cost.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn’t matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

mainBoard.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. You lose life equal to its converted mana cost.

mainBoard.name: Life
mainBoard.originalText: Return target creature card from your graveyard to play. You lose life equal to its converted mana cost.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn’t matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

mainBoard.text: All lands you control become 1/1 creatures until end of turn. They're still lands.

mainBoard.flavorText: "Fire is the universal language." —Jhoira, master artificer

foreignData.flavorText: „Die Sprache des Feuers versteht jeder." —Jhoira, Meisterbastler
foreignData.name: Stammesflammen
foreignData.text: Die Stammesflammen fügen einer Kreatur oder einem Spieler Deiner Wahl X Schadenspunkte zu, wobei X gleich der Anzahl an verschiedenen Standardlandtypen unter den Ländern, die Du kontrollierst, ist.

foreignData.flavorText: « Le feu est le langage du monde. » — Djoïra, maîtresse artificière.
foreignData.name: Flammes tribales
foreignData.text: Ces Flammes tribales infligent X blessures à une cible, créature ou joueur, X étant le nombre de types de terrains de base parmi les terrains que vous contrôlez.

mainBoard.name: Tribal Flames
mainBoard.originalText: Tribal Flames deals X damage to target creature or player, where X is the number of basic land types among lands you control.

rulings.text: To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.

How many lands you control of a particular basic land type is irrelevant to a domain ability, as long as that number is greater than zero. As far as domain is concerned, ten Forests is the same as one Forest.

A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don’t count the number of lands you control — they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you’ll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.

mainBoard.text: Domain — Tribal Flames deals X damage to any target, where X is the number of basic land types among lands you control.
